thread.title: In Transit: A Bike Tour Through in Madagascar
thread.title_full: In Transit: A Bike Tour Through in Madagascar

author: ASHLEY WINCHESTER
title: In Transit: A Bike Tour Through in Madagascar
text:
A Bike Tour Through in Madagascar JULY 20, 2015 Two Madagascar natives. Credit SpiceRoads Cycle Tours 
Advertisement See More » The 15-day itinerary includes visits with the Zafimaniry people, whose wood carving knowledge is listed as a Unesco Intangible Cultural Heritage, and rides past crater lakes, rice paddies, vineyards and beaches. “Biking from the east to the west coast, cyclists will encounter an amazing variety of lemurs, and hiking through national parks will bring them even closer to nature and a good chance of spotting the world’s smallest and biggest chameleons,” said Patricia Weismantel, a product manager for SpiceRoads. Accommodations are at small hotels, from a riverside lodge to a beach resort. Departures are scheduled for late August, September and October. The cost is $3,250 a person; single supplement and bike hire fees are extra. Reservations can be made at spiceroads.com . ASHLEY WINCHESTER A version of this article appears in print on July 19, 2015, on page TR3 of the New York edition with the headline: Tours: Hiking and Biking in Madagascar.
